snippet: Afghan government officials do not worry so much about the wrath of constituents as about being assassinated by the Taliban.
abstract: Afghan government officials worry more about being assassinated by Taliban than wrath of their constituents; Taliban have stepped up their campaign against politicians, targeting dozens of provincial and district governors, police chiefs and even marginal officials, and killings are only likely to rise when American troops withdraw.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, Jawad Sukhanyar from Parwan, and Habib Zohori from Wardak

lead_paragraph: Afghan government officials do not worry so much about the wrath of constituents as about being assassinated by the Taliban.

headline.seo: For Afghan Officials, Prospect of Death Comes With Territory
headline.main: For Afghan Officials, Facing Prospect of Death Is in the Job Description
headline.print_headline: For Afghan Officials, Facing Prospect of Death Is in the Job Description
